ygData.subject: RE: Putting Skill-Cap Questions to Rest
ygData.msgSnippet: I have that info on my chart and will publish my info to you all when I feel that the skill cap stuff is accurate enough.  If no one minds I will send the
ygData.messageBody:
I have that info on my chart and will publish my info to you all when I feel
that the skill cap stuff is accurate enough. If no one minds I will send
the chart as a Word97 format attachement verified virus free when complete.

-Faras

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Daniel P. Sniderman [mailto:slide@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 1999 2:52 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Putting Skill-Cap Questions to Rest
>
>
> From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <slide@...>
>
> Also - add the level we get the skill
>
> Slyde
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Mike Roach <mroach@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 1999 2:37 PM
> Subject: [eqbards] Putting Skill-Cap Questions to Rest
>
>
> > From: Mike Roach <mroach@...>
> >
> > I am trying to put together a comprehensive reference chart
> on all the
> skill
> > caps for skills that bards can have, including general
> skills and trade
> > skills. I have data for most of the bard-specific ones but
> am missing
> info
> > on some others, maybe some of you folks could help me fill
> in the blanks
> > (note that ones I was uncertain of I simply put a value of
> 200 - please
> > correct me if I am wrong):
> >
> > Alcohol Tolerance: 200
> > Baking: 200
>
